channel.title: half life won black screen on startup
channel.description: so today i decide to install half life won so i do this and play when the searria loga pops up there is all this pixilated mess on the top of the searria logo so i thinks its just a normal bug but after the valve logo the screen turns black i move my curser around and hear the menu sounds any fix

item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
DesertFox:

It takes a special kind of stupidity to misspell something that badly.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Opponent_Network

:retard:

It’s already been established some think it might be stolen, but there’s both no proof, and he’s already found the source of the issue, so you can quit being so hostile.

Read full topic
item.source: half life won black screen on startup

item.title: half life won black screen on startup
item.dc:creator: DesertFox
item.description:
Half-Life “won” ?

It takes a special kind of stupidity to misspell something that badly.

Crypt19:
lightninrod4:

i copied the iso off a disc im trying not to use the steam version cause it dosent work with all the mods

Why? Seems like a stupid and useless thing to do. Are you sure YOU copied the ISO off the disk and not say… someone else, years ago across the planet?

I’m pretty fluent in stupid. I’ll translate it for you.

“I don’t own Half-Life 1, I torrented it. I’m saying that I got it off of steam because I don’t want people to make fun of me.”

Read full topic

item.source: half life won black screen on startup

item.title: half life won black screen on startup
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
lightninrod4:

2also i copied the iso off a disc

Why? Seems like a stupid and useless thing to do. Are you sure YOU copied the ISO off the disk and not say… someone else, years ago across the planet?

im trying not to use the steam version cause it dosent work with all the mods

Like? I’ve never encountered one.

Anyway, if I ignore the part of my brain that says you’re clearly committing piracy, what OS are you using and have you tried running in compatibility mode? Sounds like an OS compatibility problem, or your install wasn’t successful. You should go get the CD you copied the ISO from and try reinstalling from that. It’s possible your ISO is corrupt.

Read full topic
